column2: CONNECTICUT DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Connecticut
column6: CT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the right.
column6: No one.
column8: The driver on the left.

column2: 2. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.
column6: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.
column8: keep a safe following distance.

column2: 3. If it safe to do so, you can pass a vehicle ahead when:
column4: there is a solid line on your side of the road.
column6: there is a broken line on your side of the road.
column8: you are on a hill or curve.

column2: 4. A curb painted red means:
column4: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
column6: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
column8: No parking or stopping

column2: 5. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 6. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: Yield
column6: School zone
column8: Stop

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles are not allowed in this area
column6: Watch for bicycles
column8: Bicycle parking ahead

column2: 8. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 9. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: Pedestrians may turn right.
column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 10. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: pump the brakes.
column6: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column8: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 11. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: check their mirrors for traffic.
column6: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.
column8: place their foot on the accelerator.

column2: 12. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 13. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
column8: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.

column2: 14. If you are 16 or 17 years old and are convicted of speeding 20 mph over the speed limit, your license will be suspended for:
column4: 60 days.
column6: 45 days.
column8: 30 days.

column2: 15. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Warnings
column6: Law
column8: Suggestions

column2: 16. When changing lanes:
column4: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column6: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
column8: slow down and check your left mirror.

column2: 17. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: call the fire department immediately.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 18. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Slippery when wet
column6: Steep downgrade
column8: Work work ahead

column2: 20. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column6: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column8: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.

column2: 21. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 22. A defensive driver:
column4: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
column6: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column8: never drives below the speed limit.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: School crossing
column6: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Bicycle crossing

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column6: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed
column8: Winding roadÂ ahead

column2: 25. Signs that indicate a No Passing Zone tell drivers that:
column4: they should speed up and pass the vehicle in front of them.
column6: it is not safe to pass.
column8: they should maintain their current speed.
